page.title: 19HISTORICAL HOUSES
page.content: THERE STILL REMAIN MANY OLD HOUSES IN THIS AREA THESE ARE MAINLY THATCHED COTTAGES WHICH ARE NOT VERY LARGE. {SALDEN HOUSE}IS ALL THAT REMAINS OF THE PALATIAL MANOR HOUSE THAT WAS BOUGHT BY SIR JOHN FORTESCUE IN 1570.AS IT TOOK TWENTY YEARS AT A COST OF Â£33,000 TO REBUILD.THE LADY CECILY NEVER LIVED TO SEE IT.WE SAW SOME OF THE OLD WINDOWS.THE GLASS WAS YELLOW AND VERY THICK WITH AGE.WE SAW SOME OLD COBBLES THAT WERE PART OF THE OLD FLOOR.WE WERE TAKEN OUTSIDE AND SHOWN THE REMAINS OF THE ARCHES WHICH FORMED THE DECORATION OF THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE.THERE WAS EVIDENCE OF THE BOWLING GREEN AND THE OLD DRIVE WITH YEW TREES LINING IT.THIS MUST HAVE BEEN VERY IMPRESSIVE.NOWADAYS IT IS A FAMILY HOUSE WITH ONLY TWO ACRES OF LAND.
